metadata.builder_notes: Scaffolding fades dramatically from Stage 1 (60% blanks, multiple choice) to Stage 4 (0% blanks, authentic). Focus is on pragmatic function words, with repair markers only triggered if tension rises.

blank_insertion_strategy.overall_approach: Prioritize pragmatic function words over content words
blank_insertion_strategy.priority_2: Repair markers (activated if conversation becomes tense)
blank_insertion_strategy.avoid: Content words (deadline, project, database), articles (a, the), minor verbs

rule_1_softening_phrases.priority: HIGHEST - always blank unless very early recognition stage
rule_1_softening_phrases.cognitive_load: Medium - requires understanding context to generate

rule_3_acknowledgment.placement: After each point made by interlocutor

rule_4_proposals.priority: MEDIUM - important but not in every turn

rule_5_repair_markers.placement: ONLY if tension detected in dialogue
rule_5_repair_markers.priority: CONDITIONAL - needed only if tone becomes negative

rule_6_avoid_blanking.rationale: These are either grammatical items (not pedagogical targets) or content words (learner should use if they know)
rule_6_avoid_blanking.exception: Some content blanks OK in Stage 1 (recognition), but minimized in Stages 3-4

stage_1_recognition_and_recall.name: Recognition + Recall with Maximum Support
stage_1_recognition_and_recall.blank_example: I see your point, but ___ we extend the deadline? (A) should (B) can (C) could
stage_1_recognition_and_recall.cognitive_load: High - focus on recognition, not production
stage_1_recognition_and_recall.learner_task: Recognize correct softener in context and understand meaning

feedback.content: 'Good! That's how we soften disagreement without refusing.'

stage_2_guided_production.name: Guided Production with Scaffolding
stage_2_guided_production.blank_example: I understand your deadline pressure, [t__ be ____ ], we need more time.
stage_2_guided_production.learner_task: Retrieve softener from memory and produce it, with letter cues

feedback.content: 'Good attempt! The softener needs 2 words. Think of 'To be ___'.
feedback.tone_detail: Hints towards correct answer rather than giving it

stage_3_semi_authentic_task.name: Semi-Authentic Negotiation with Minimal Support
stage_3_semi_authentic_task.blank_example: [CUES: Manager just said deadline is firm. You disagree. Soften your disagreement.] Learner: ___
stage_3_semi_authentic_task.cognitive_load: Low - authentic task with minimal hints
stage_3_semi_authentic_task.learner_task: Spontaneously soften disagreement in authentic negotiation scenario

feedback.content: 'Great job softening in turns 2 and 4. What about turn 6 - how did you handle it?'

stage_4_authentic_negotiation.name: Fully Authentic Negotiation with Zero Support
stage_4_authentic_negotiation.learner_task: Negotiate authentically with dynamic partner. Use chunks spontaneously.
pragmatic_functions_emphasized: ALL - softening, hedging, acknowledging, proposing, repairing
stage_4_authentic_negotiation.success_metric: Peer evaluation of pragmatic competence + self-reflection

feedback.content: 'What softeners did you use? Did they help you reach agreement?'
feedback.tone_detail: Learner identifies own pragmatic choices; teacher facilitates reflection

progression_cognitive_load.stage_1_to_2: Scaffolding: Multiple choice → Word prompts (-25% cognitive load)
progression_cognitive_load.stage_2_to_3: Scaffolding: Word prompts → Situational cues (-25% cognitive load)
progression_cognitive_load.overall_pattern: Linear reduction from HIGH scaffolding (Stage 1) to ZERO scaffolding (Stage 4)
progression_cognitive_load.validation: Each stage is achievable next step from previous; no jumps in difficulty

tension_activated_features.trigger_for_repair_markers: If dialogue becomes tense (manager frustrated, learner defensive)
tension_activated_features.when_activated: Usually Stage 3-4 (earlier stages have enough scaffolding)

examples.situation: Manager: 'This is unacceptable. I promised the client.'
examples.repair_blank: [CUES: Manager is frustrated. Repair the tone without backing down.] Learner: ___
examples.expected: I hear you. I'm not trying to make this difficult; I'm being realistic so we don't fail twice.

examples.repair_blank: [CUES: You sounded defensive. Clarify your position calmly.] Learner: ___
examples.expected: What I mean is, I'm not refusing - I'm saying we need time to do this right.

blank_placement_algorithm.step_1_identify_candidate_phrases: Find all phrases matching priority rules (softeners, hedges, acknowledgments, proposals)

step_2_score_by_stage.stage_1: Score = 1.0 if softener/acknowledgment, 0.7 if hedge, 0.5 if proposal
step_2_score_by_stage.stage_2: Score = 1.0 if softener/hedge, 0.8 if acknowledgment, 0.5 if proposal
step_2_score_by_stage.stage_3: Score = 0.8 if softener/hedge, 0.7 if acknowledgment/proposal, 0.3 if other

blank_placement_algorithm.step_3_apply_percentage: Select top-scored phrases up to stage's blank percentage
blank_placement_algorithm.step_4_validate_linguistic_sense: Ensure blank placement doesn't disrupt grammar or meaning
blank_placement_algorithm.step_5_ensure_variety: No same blank format appears twice in a row

stage_1_feedback.content: Praise correct answers + explain pragmatic choice
stage_1_feedback.example: 'Yes! 'I see your point' softens the disagreement. It shows respect before you say you disagree.'

stage_2_feedback.content: If wrong, hint at shape/meaning without giving answer
stage_2_feedback.example: 'Almost! This softener has 3 words: 'To be ___'. What's the emotional state you're expressing?'

stage_3_feedback.content: Praise pragmatic choices; ask learner to reflect on effectiveness
stage_3_feedback.example: 'You softened nicely. Did the manager respond better because of your softening?'

stage_4_feedback.content: Partner feedback on tone; learner self-assesses pragmatic competence
stage_4_feedback.example: 'Did you feel the softening helped reach agreement? What would you do differently?'

blank_insertion_sequence: Generate blanks with appropriate format (MC → prompts → cues → none)
